glosses: to interpret something as (good/bad); to take something to be a (good/bad) sign

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish یورمق (yormak), from Proto-Turkic *yȫr- (“1. to untie 2. to explain, interpret”). Cognate with Old Turkic [script needed] (yor-, “to explain, interpret (a dream)”), Turkmen ýormak (“to foretell, interpret”), Kyrgyz жоруу (joruu, “to interpret”), Kazakh жору (joru, “to interpret”).
